task_summary: Robot detects, approaches, grasps the lid, and opens a small box using a top grasp and lid manipulation.

task_long_description.overview: This episode requires a robot arm to open a small storage box situated on a tabletop. The box has a hinged or removable lid. The robot must visually locate the box, approach and align above the lid, compute a suitable grasp pose (top grasp), execute the grasp, and actuate the lid opening action. Once open, the robot confirms success, retreats, and waits. Visual perception is used to guide actions and confirm progress.
preconditions: Box present on table within reach
No occlusions blocking box or lid
stepwise_plan: Check if box is visible; scan if not
Detect box and localize for approach
Compute grasp pose for box lid
Grasp box lid with top strategy
Wait for confirmation or next instruction
success_criteria: Box lid opened fully or sufficiently
Robot arm returns to neutral after opening
failure_and_recovery: Lid slip or failed grasp (retry or replan)
task_long_description.termination: Tree runs until box is open and robot safely retreats.
